citeinfo.title: HOSPITALS_HAZUS_IN: Hospitals and Clinics in Indiana, Derived from HAZUS (Federal Emergency Management Agency, Point Shapefile)
citeinfo.othercit: This shapefile was derived from a predecessor shapefile, named "HOSPITAL.SHP," which was derived from a shapefile (named "EFCARE.SHP") provided by the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) and the National Institute of Building Sciences (NIBS). EFCARE was included on a CD-ROM (titled "arcHAZUS99, Central US") that is the product of a program referred to as "HAZUS, The FEMA Tool for Estimating Earthquake Losses." The original shapefile (referred to as "EFCARE.SHP") has been modified by personnel of the IGS. These metadata were created by personnel of IGS, using information included in the HAZUS user's manuals.

descript.abstract: HOSPITALS_HAZUS_IN is a point shapefile that shows locations of hospitals and clinics in Indiana. HOSPITALS_HAZUS_IN was derived from the shapefile named "HOSPITAL." A predecessor shapefile of HOSPITAL, named "EFCARE," was obtained by the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) from the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) and the National Institute of Building Sciences (NIBS). The shapefile was included on a CD-ROM (titled "arcHAZUS99, Central US") that is the product of a program referred to as "HAZUS, The FEMA Tool for Estimating Earthquake Losses." The original shapefile (referred to as "EFCARE.SHP") has been modified by personnel of the IGS. These metadata were created by personnel of IGS, using information included in the HAZUS user's manuals. Data for the predecessor shapefile was obtained from an AHA Database (1999) (HAZUS99, Technical and User Manuals, Appendices.pdf, Appendix D, Summary of Inventory Databases.)
descript.purpose: The predecessor shapefile ("EFCARE.SHP") was produced by FEMA and NIBS to serve as supplemental data for use by HAZUS, a software tool for estimating earthquake losses. That predecessor shapefile was then modified by personnel of IGS to provide a GIS layer that could be included within the GIS repository of IGS.

idinfo.native: ESRI ArcView version 3.2 shapefile format, approximately 38 Kb

citeinfo.title: HAZUS, The FEMA Tool for Estimating Earthquake Losses

pubinfo.publish: Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA); National Institute of Building Sciences (NIBS)

srcinfo.srccontr: The data contained within EFCARE.SHP were used to generate a shapefile named "HOSPITAL."

procstep.procdesc: A shapefile named "EFCARE.SHP" was obtained from the CD-ROM titled "arcHAZUS99, Central US" by personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS). The shapefile was opened in ESRI ArcView. Within ESRI ArcView, the projection was set to UTM NAD83, Zone 16. The original shapefile was then converted to another shapefile (named "HOSPITAL.SHP") by using the "Convert to Shapefile" utility of ESRI ArcView. The Table Edit function of ESRI ArcView was then used to drop the following fields: ID, state, zipcode, contact, phone, class, mapping, bldg_type, designlvl, bias, foundation, year_b, cost, bu_pwr, aha_id, elevat, lat, long, geores, county, comment, ID_.
The shapefile named "HOSPITAL" was clipped to INCLP83, a boundary coverage for the State of Indiana (compiled at a scale of 1:24,000). The resulting shapefile was named "HOSPITALS_HAZUS_IN."

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
